Detailed Description

Abstract base class for all games.

This base class implements the basic methods required for an iterated game between players. It handles validation of basic game moves and storing of game history over time.

virtual void Game::GetGamePayoff ( const Player *  playerOne,
int &  playerOneScore,
const Player *  playerTwo,
int &  playerTwoScore 
) [protected, pure virtual]

Function determining game payoff.

This function will read playerOne.nextMove and playerTwo.nextMove to determine each player's score. The score earned is set as output in playerOneScore and playerTwoScore.

Parameters:
playerOneFirst player in game
[out]playerOneScoreScore the first player will receive this round
playerTwoSecond player in game
[out]playerTwoScoreScore the second player will receive this round

Implemented in PrisonerDilemma.

bool Game::Play ( Player *  playerOne,
Player *  playerTwo 
)

Play one round of this game between two players.

This function will validate the players' next moves, compute the score, and add the turn to the game history.

Parameters:
playerOneFirst player in game
playerTwoSecond player in game
Returns:
True if the game was successfully played, false if one of the players attempted an invalid move
virtual void Game::Reset ( ) [virtual]

Reset the game state.

This function clears the stored game history.

Member Data Documentation

wxArrayString Game::gameHistory [protected]

The history of all turns that have been taken in this game.

Each member of this array is the result of a particular turn. It is a wxString of length two -- the first character is the first player's move, the second character the second.

Note that this game history does not notice if the players participating in a game change while the game is in progress. If you wish to use this history, you shouldn't change the players, or you should make sure to call Game::Reset before doing so.

wxString Game::gameMoves [protected]

Permissible game moves.

This string is a list of the permissible moves each player can make. As an example, the prisoner's dilemma gameMoves string would be "CD", as players may either cooperate or defect on each turn.

Note:
If the game is one, like the prisoner's dilemma, for which the TitForTat player has a "first move" that it should always take, that move must be gameMoves[0]. TitForTatPlayer will open with gameMoves[0]. In other words, if there is a "cooperate" action, it must be listed first.
